name: react-boilerplate
description: A basic template to setup a React based project, using Webpack
author: Richard Memory

dependencies_documentation.react: A painless way to create interactive UIs using JS.
dependencies_documentation.react-overdrive: easy magic-move transitions for React apps
dependencies_documentation.react-dom: Provides DOM-specific methods for the browser
dependencies_documentation.react-prop-types: Runtime type checking for React properties
dependencies_documentation.react-router-dom: Provides routing capabilities to React for the browser
dependencies_documentation.styled-components: allows you to write actual CSS code to style your components. It also removes the mapping between components and styles
dependencies_documentation.react-state: A fancy component for managing deep state
dependencies_documentation.react-transition-group: An easy way to perform animations when a React component enters or leaves the DOM

devDependencies_documentation.babel-core: Core dependencies for Babel, which is a transpiler that compiles JavaScript ES6 to JavaScript ES5 allowing you to write JavaScript from the future so that current browsers will understand it.
devDependencies_documentation.babel-loader: This package allows transpiling JavaScript files using Babel and webpack
devDependencies_documentation.babel-polyfill: Allows usage of promises, weakmap, etc
devDependencies_documentation.babel-preset-env: With this you don’t have to specify if you will be writing ES2015, ES2016 or ES2017. Babel will automatically detect and transpile accordingly.
devDependencies_documentation.babel-preset-react: Tells Babel we will be using React
devDependencies_documentation.babel-preset-stage-1: JS stage-1 features are proposed, which is one step above stage-0: strawman
devDependencies_documentation.css-loader: Interprets @import and url() like import/require() and will resolve them
devDependencies_documentation.html-webpack-plugin: Can generate an HTML file for your application, or you can provide a template
devDependencies_documentation.style-loader: Adds CSS to the DOM by injecting a <style> tag
devDependencies_documentation.eslint and friends: A ton of help to insure I don't write crappy code
devDependencies_documentation.concurrently: Allows me to run multiple npm commands concurrently, like npm run watch * npm run watch-less, etc
devDependencies_documentation.webpack and friends: The magical bundler that pulls it all together, which sorts out all of the imports, components, styles, lazy loading, etc.
